alert.note: Alert for Saratoga; Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 10:33AM EDT until April 10 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Hudson River At Fort Edward. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Moderate flood stage. Water floods River Road in Northumberland and reaches camps in Lake Luzerne. It may also result in flooding in Stillwater. Water is over the concrete wall at the Fort Edward Yacht Basin and several homes nearby have water approaching them. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 26.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.9 feet on 04/17/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Hudson River Fort Edward Flood Stage: 26.0 Observed Stage at Fri 9 am: 24.8 Forecast: Fri 2 pm 26.0 Fri 8 pm 26.8 Sat 2 am 26.9 Sat 8 am 26.8 Sat 2 pm 26.5 Sat 8 pm 26.2 Sun 2 am 25.9 Sun 8 am 25.7 Sun 2 pm 25.5 Sun 8 pm 25.3 Mon 2 am 25.1 &&
